## Key Insights

- **Endless Mode Feature**: Significant work on implementing Endless Mode functionality in the Dashboard, including stats tracking, UI components, and status management (observations #2118, #2112, #2110, #2107, #2106).
- **Settings View Development**: Comprehensive Settings view implementation with multiple tabs (General, Provider, Context, Workers, Processing, Advanced) and reusable components (FormField, ApiKeyInput) (observations #2023-#2001).
- **Real-time Dashboard**: DashboardView uses Server-Sent Events (SSE) for real-time updates and displays various metrics through stat cards (observations #2709, #2108, #2105, #2104).
- **Achievement System**: Discovery of an achievement tracking system in the Insights view with progress tracking and API integration (observation #2280).
- **Component Architecture**: The project follows a modular component structure with barrel exports and reusable UI components (observations #2023, #2002).

## Recent Session Summaries

- **Documentation & Analysis**: Completed documentation of codebase structure, identified feature requests (batch import, compact search mode), and analyzed token compression efficiency (94.5% reduction).
- **Performance Issues**: Discovered significant performance issues with ChromaDB and SQLite lock contention in multi-instance setups.
- **WebSocket Implementation**: Found partial WebSocket hook implementation with channel-based subscriptions and auth protocol.
- **Prioritization**: Next steps include implementing batch document import, SQLite-only mode, and addressing multi-instance lock contention.

## Next Steps

1. Complete Endless Mode implementation with comprehensive stats tracking and UI integration.
2. Finalize Settings view with all configuration options and validation.
3. Address performance issues with ChromaDB and SQLite lock contention.
4. Implement proposed features like batch document import and compact search mode.
5. Continue component modularization and reusable UI patterns.
